result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul Christian Owens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Paul Christian Owens is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Paul Christian Owens was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay restitution to the Sportz Page Bar & Grill in the amount of $1,327.50 jointly and severally with Brian A. Mason.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant shall serve 20 days in the Lafayette County Jail with work release privileges.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 4:00 PM.
Defendant Paul Christian Owens in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs the court pleas were entered on March 08.
The Court adopts the plea agreement.
Count 1- Sentence withheld probation ordered 3 yrs with conditins
Count 2- Dismiss
Count 3- Dismiss
Sentencing hearing on April 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Case called at 11:40 AM.
Defendant Paul Christian Owens in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.   Katherine Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bucher informs the court this matter is resolved.
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" to Count 1
State moves to dismiss Counts 2 & 3.
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights, court also questions attorney Bucher re: her clients plea and waiver.
Court finds plea and waiver is made knowingly, voluntarily & intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to Count 1.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Case called at 9:11 AM.
Attorney Bucher informs the court this matter is resolved and moves to continue for plea/sentencing. (plea agreement)
No objection.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Paul Christian Owens in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case Called @ 3:21 PM.
Attorney Bucher informs the court this matter is not going to final disposition, and moves for plea/sentencing date.
No objection by the state. Defendant Paul Christian Owens in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher. Prosecuting Atty Katherine M. Findley appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Paul Christian Owens in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case called @ 1:04 PM


Attorney Bucher files waiver of preliminary hearing
Christopher Owen is affirmed and testifies.

Court informs defendant RE: his right to preliminary hearing and purpose of said hearing.
Court also questions attorney Bucher re: her clients waiver of preliminary.

Court find waiver is made freely, knowingly & voluntarily, court orders defendant be bound over for arraignment.




 Defendant Paul Christian Owens in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher. Prosecuting Atty Katherine M. Findley appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with "The Sportz Page Bar & Grill" located at 205 East Milwaukee Street, Argyle, WI 53504.
